body:
@michilehr though the composer.phar was downloaded a few days ago I did as you asked but that does not solve it:

``` bash

mvriel@selena:/media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller$ php ../phpDocumentor2/composer.phar self-update
Updating to version 6bd7ca0.
    Downloading: 100%         
mvriel@selena:/media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller$ php ../phpDocumentor2/composer.phar update --dev
Loading composer repositories with package information
Updating dependencies
Nothing to install or update
Loading composer repositories with package information
Updating dev dependencies
Writing lock file
Generating autoload files
mvriel@selena:/media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller$ php vendor/bin/phpunit 
PHP Fatal error:  Cannot redeclare php_tokenstream_autoload() (previously declared in /media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller/vendor/phpunit/php-token-stream/PHP/Token/Stream/Autoload.php:45) in /media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller/vendor/phpunit/php-token-stream/PHP/Token/Stream/Autoload.php on line 230
PHP Stack trace:
PHP   1. {main}() /media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/composer/bin/phpunit:0
PHP   2. require() /media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/composer/bin/phpunit:40
PHP   3. ComposerAutoloaderInit::getLoader() /media/Elements/Projects/phpDocumentor/UnifiedAssetInstaller/vendor/autoload.php:7
```
Use phpunit/phpunit: 3.7.*@stable to get the latest version that fixes this issue.
At first I thought this did indeed solve the issue but I just started a new repo and am still encountering those issues: https://github.com/mvriel/Deusim/blob/master/composer.json

@mvriel For me it's working (now) using your composer.json

```
php composer.phar install
Loading composer repositories with package information
Installing dependencies
  - Installing symfony/finder (2.1.x-dev v2.1.0-RC2)
    Cloning v2.1.0-RC2

  - Installing symfony/process (2.1.x-dev v2.1.2)
    Cloning v2.1.2

  - Installing symfony/console (2.1.x-dev 57d03f8)
    Cloning 57d03f87db82eee2d63c2a6a7f767c2e376f6d35

  - Installing pimple/pimple (dev-master b9f27b8)
    Cloning b9f27b8dc18c08f00627dec02359b46a24791dc3

  - Installing cilex/cilex (dev-master 1a4cb7a)
    Cloning 1a4cb7a2e4b03b77bbb52dd08c034c12e26b3d4c

cilex/cilex suggests installing monolog/monolog (>=1.0.0)
cilex/cilex suggests installing symfony/yaml (>=1.0.0)
cilex/cilex suggests installing symfony/validator (>=1.0.0)
Writing lock file
Generating autoload files
```

Working for you too?
@edorian the installation is not the problem; the execution of PHPUnit is.

Ah sorry. Didn't try that as the project didn't have any tests.

Also fails for me then (after removing the `"minimum-stability": "dev"`)

@edorian I just did an update of my Composer file and pushed the lock to master so to test if this is still an issue.
According to travis it is: http://travis-ci.org/#!/phpDocumentor/phpDocumentor2/jobs/2560418
This appears to affect dev, 3.7.1 and 3.7.0
